posts.name: Dario
posts.cooked:
Would it be possible/feasible to have an option to auto-delete/cull messages based on the age/date of the message, not how many messages are in a given conversation? I‚Äôd like to only keep the last 6 months of messages in a given conversation, no matter how many there are.

I could see that being covered by disappearing messages, but that‚Äôs set conversation-by-conversation, right? I‚Äôd like to have a global setting like we already have under ‚ÄúMessage trimming‚Äù, just based on age instead of length‚Ä¶

link_counts.title: Signal is taking up 504MB how can we make a button to clear cache?

posts.name: Tobias Leupold
posts.cooked:
Hi devs,

a part of what I‚Äôd suggest to add has already been requested some years ago in delete old messages after certain time ¬∑ Issue #3047 ¬∑ signalapp/Signal-Android ¬∑ GitHub , but this one has been auto-closed some time ago.

I would really like to be able to delete old messages automatically not only by messages count, but also by date. The count trimming is not useful in two cases: If you have a group chat with 100 messages one evening, and chats with a low message frequency. If I delete messages before 500, that could be two days ago, or I never reach 500 and no messages are deleted at all.

I would suggest to add an additional option ‚ÄúAutomatically delete messages older than x days‚Äù. Either, one can choose this, or the count method, or ‚Äì if both are selected ‚Äì messages are deleted that are older than the given timeapan or exceed the count ‚Äì whatever happens first.

This would be very nice. Esp. to clean up some pictures/videos garbage that eats a lot of memory. With a bare count limit, one won‚Äôt reach those even if they are years old if there are simply not enough messages in the chat.

To put the cherry on the cake, I‚Äôd love to have this setting available for each individial chat/group chat. An option ‚ÄúUse global settings‚Äù, or ‚ÄúSettings for this chat‚Äù, with those two approaches.

Just to request this once again ‚Ä¶

Cheers, Tobias

link_counts.title: delete old messages after certain time ¬∑ Issue #3047 ¬∑ signalapp/Signal-Android ¬∑ GitHub

posts.cooked: Can‚Äôt you already do this with disappearing messages? Do you not want to impose your choice on the other side? Are the timers there too limited?

posts.name: Tobias Leupold
posts.cooked: I think this option is for my own messages disappearing on the other side(s)? I don‚Äôt want to limit the lifespan of my messages for the other side, I want to clean up (only) my own chat history ‚Ä¶
I would love to have this trim feature for the iOS app as well. And I would prefer the time over the message count as well. iMessage has this feature. You csn choose between 30 days and one year.

This coming for Android soon. It‚Äôs now in the new beta. I really would love to see this feature for the iOS app - and also for the desktop. It‚Äôs one of my most missed features!

Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 4.71 release Android Beta Feedback
We‚Äôre releasing the Signal 4.71 beta soon. If you‚Äôre interested in participating, join the beta group here. Share your feedback on the latest changes: ‚òÖ Dive into new storage management options that let you decide how long to keep messages and quickly free up additional space. Summer is a great time to go for a trim. Complete list of new commits since v4.70.5 https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v4.70.5‚Ä¶master Thank you for being a beta tester!

Yes!!! I want this to!
Or the ability to set auto delete as default. Now when i start a new conversation it hapends from time to time that i accedently forget to turn it on. And yea i can delete my side of that start conversation but i dont have control about the other side.
I woud even want to go as far as only accept incoming messeges if it are turnd on.

posts.name: link ‚ú¶
posts.cooked:
Rocco420:

Yes!!! I want this to!

Well, good news, it‚Äôs already available on Android

Rocco420:

Or the ability to set auto delete as default. Now when i start a new conversation it hapends from time to time that i accedently forget to turn it on. And yea i can delete my side of that start conversation but i dont have control about the other side.
I woud even want to go as far as only accept incoming messeges if it are turnd on.

Note that this topic is about a local deletion feature. Here however, you‚Äôre talking about automatically enabling disappearing messages, which affect all conversation participants (which you‚Äôve later opened a separate topic about: Auto Delete, settings by default).

This was implemented, but possible time frames are limited to predefined options. I personally would want to delete messages older than 2 years, but right now max possible range is 1 year. Having ‚ÄúCustom‚Äù option (like for conversation length) would make it much more flexible and consistent.

posts.cooked: There is an option on Android under settings > storage that let‚Äôs you keep messages forever, 1 year, six months, or 30 days.

posts.name: link ‚ú¶
posts.cooked:
Avitus:

There is an option on Android under settings > storage that let‚Äôs you keep messages forever, 1 year, six months, or 30 days.

Indeed, this feature request can be generally considered solved for Android (but not for iOS or Desktop). Although even for Android, some requested things are still missing:

  • Post #3: Separate configuration for each conversation:

    doc_l3u:

    To put the cherry on the cake, I‚Äôd love to have this setting available for each individial chat/group chat. An option ‚ÄúUse global settings‚Äù, or ‚ÄúSettings for this chat‚Äù, with those two approaches.

  • Post #13: Custom time intervals.

posts.name: Tobias Leupold
posts.cooked:
Well, it‚Äôs at least partially solved. At least for Android ;-)

The per-conversation setting and a custom timespan would be nice, but this is probably something for another request.

Signal uses approximately +1GB per month of my phones storage (I send a lot of baby videos to grandma and grandpa).

So I was looking for a way to free some storage without loosing everything instantaneously.

Currently you can only wipe your device. I think it would be prudent to allow for a more specific cleanup. Like ‚Äûdelete all messages older than 6 month‚Äú.

This feature request is a little broader, but in the core it also would like to have message trimming and more control and information over the data received:

Data and space management for iOS app iOS Feature Requests
I played along yesterday with my friend WhatsApp application he had on his iPhone. Disclaimer, I did not have too much experience with WhatsApp, I just saw instances of it, here and there. I would like to request a feature that blew my mind on WhatsApp: the ability to see and manage not only data consumtion, but memory space occupied by each conversation. More in depth: I would like to have a screen in Settings, where I can see the Network Usage Messages sent/received, bytes sent/receiv‚Ä¶

Edit: Missing words inserted ‚Ä¶

link_counts.title: Data and space management for iOS app

posts.cooked: My hope is that building upon the existing functionality this could be a low hanging fruit to implement.

I‚Äôm really waiting for the implementation of this feature in each new (beta) release of the Signal iOS app and have been disappointed for approximately the last two years. I thought the same as you that it could not be so hard to implement the feature from the Android app in the iOS app. Except for backups this is my number one feature which I‚Äôm missing with Signal (and it would be nice to have it for the desktop as well).

I‚Äôve marked this as not solved because iOS and Desktop still don‚Äôt have time-based message trimming, and the broader feature request linked to by @patjolata seems to be a bit too broad (plus, we still have a separate request for size-based message trimming, so it seems fair).

Is it possible to implement it not globally to all conversations but to a single one? Also I‚Äôd like it not to be enabled for all participants but only for me.

The use case I have is that I am participant of a quite big group where a lot of messages and multimedia is shared. I don‚Äôt need old messages (even like a month old) and would love to have an option to autoremove old messages and multimedia there. There is currently an option like disappearing messages but it seems it affects all participants and I‚Äôd like it only for me because others would like messages to live longer or even forever.

Hi,

I search in parameters option, but I don‚Äôt find anything to manage easily old data
I imagine something like:
Buttons with for example 5 options something like:

  • remove old data over 1 month
  • remove old data over 3 months
  • remove old data over 6 months
  • remove old data over 1 year
  • remove all data

Thanks
using 7.22.2 signal desktop under linux ubuntu
